intro: Hieracium milesii, commonly known as the mile's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc and surrounding ray florets. Hieracium milesii is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed habitats.
